column4: How hard is it to create an ftp server with different users that direct to their respective directory?
almost every ftp server does that by default
apt-get install vsftpd then nano /etc/vsftpd.conf to change the configuration to your taste.  done.
what do I need to change to tell it what directory to go to for each user?
do you want it to go to the user's home directory?
you have to do sudo /etc/init.d/vsftpd restart after making changes to the configuration
try doing stop instead of restart, then do start
do /etc/init.d/vsftpd stop, then do ps aux | grep vsftpd and tell me if any processes show up for vsftpd still
my login isn't even accepted, my password either
I'm not sure what to say, you either didn't entirely restart vsftpd or you messed something up in the configuration
